title: CHARCURVE (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK CHARCURVE
Maps an input signal onto a characteristic curve
The characteristic curve is given by an array of POINTs, which include a set of X-values
with their corresponding Y-values.
Example in ST:
VAR
CHARACTERISTIC_LINE
:
CHARCURVE
;
KL
:
ARRAY
[0..10]
OF
POINT
:=
[(X:=0,Y:=0),(X:=250,Y:=50),
(X:=500,Y:=150),(X:=750,Y:=400), 7((X:=1000,Y:=1000))]
;
COUNTER
:
INT
;
END_VAR
COUNTER
:=
COUNTER
+10
;
supply
CHARCURVE
with
for
example
a
constantly
increasing
value
CHARACTERISTIC_LINE
(
IN
:=
COUNTER
,
N
:=
5
,
P
:=
KL
);
Illustration of the resulting curve

rows: Number of points defining the characteristic curve : 2 <=N<= 11

rows.Name: P
rows.Comment: Array of points to describe the characteristic curve

rows.Name: OUT
rows.Comment: Output variable, contains the manipulated value

rows: 0 : No error1 : Error inP: wrong sequence (completely tested, only ifINis equal to largest X-value ofP)2 :INoutside of limits ofP4 :Ninvalid, number of points not within the allowed range 2..11
